column2: Q0. This is the Student Short Survey [student_short_v1.0.0].
column3: Q1. Do you have a cell phone?
column4: Q2. If yes, is it a smartphone with apps and access to the internet?
column5: Q3. Do you feel you can contact your parent(s) in a timely manner when you need to during the school day?
column6: Q4a. Do you bring a phone to school?
column7: Q4a.1. If you bring a phone to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
column8: Q4a.2. If you bring a phone to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
column9: Q4b. Do you bring a tablet to school?
column10: Q4b.1. If you bring a tablet to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
column11: Q4b.2. If you bring a tablet to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
column12: Q4c. Do you bring a laptop to school?
column13: Q4c.1. If you bring a laptop to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
column14: Q4c.2. If you bring a laptop to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
column15: Q4d. Do you bring a smartwatch to school?
column16: Q4d.1. If you bring a smartwatch to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
column17: Q4d.2. If you bring a smartwatch to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
column18: Q4e. Do you bring another device to school?
column20: Q4e.2. If you bring the device to school, do you use it for school purposes, like classwork?
column21: Q4e.3. If you bring the device to school, do you use it for personal reasons, like social media or talking to friends?
column22: Q5. On an average school day (from when you arrive at school to when you leave), how much time do you spend using your phone? (in hours)
column23: Q6. Please rate your agreement with this statement: “I feel worried about missing out on things when I don’t have access to my phone.”
column24: Q7. Do you have a job?
column25:
Q8. If you have a job outside of school, around how many times does your boss/supervisor contact you through your mobile phone each week during the school day? 

Number of times per week:
column26:
Q9. During a single school day, around how many times do your parents contact you through your mobile phone?  

Number of times per day:
column27: Q10. Does your school have a phone policy?
column28: Q11. Under your school’s phone policy, when are students allowed to use their phones at school? Select all that apply.
column29: Q12. How does your school restrict access to phones?  Select all that apply.
column30: Q13. How satisfied are you with your school’s phone policy?
column31: Q14. How consistently do teachers and staff enforce your school's phone policy? Give your best guess.
column32: Q15. What percentage of your classmates are using their phone when they shouldn’t be? Give your best guess.
column33: Q16. In your opinion, should your school's phone policy be more or less restrictive than it is now?
column34: Q17. In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience. [Q17.1. In general, I pay attention in class.]
column35: Q17. In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience. [Q17.2. In class, I often pretend to be working when I’m not.]
column36: Q17. In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience. [Q17.3. If I forgot my lunch or needed a small amount of money, I believe my friends would help me out.]
column37: Q17. In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience. [Q17.4. My friends and I usually spend our free time together during school, not on our phones.]
column38: Q17. In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience. [Q17.5. I feel like I belong at school.]
column39: Q17. In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience. [Q17.6. I often feel lonely at school.]
column40: Q17. In the following set of questions, we will ask about how you view your school experience. [Q17.7. In general, I enjoy going to school.]
column41: Q18. On school nights, how many hours of sleep do you usually get? (in hours)
column42: Q19. How would you rate the quality of your sleep?
column43:
Q20. During the past 7 days, on how many days were you physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day? (Add up all the time you spent in any kind of physical activity that increased your heart rate and made you breathe hard some of the time.)

Number of days:
column44:
Q21. During the past 30 days, on how many days did you not go to school because you felt you would be unsafe at school? 

Number of days:
column45: Q22. Now, here are some questions about you. [Q22.1. Overall, I am happy with myself.]
column46: Q22. Now, here are some questions about you. [Q22.2. I often have trouble getting along with my classmates.]
column47: Q22. Now, here are some questions about you. [Q22.3. I fight a lot.]
column48: Q23. In the past four weeks, how often have you experienced the following? [Q23.1. I have no energy for things.]

column50: Q23. In the past four weeks, how often have you experienced the following? [Q23.3. I feel worthless.]

column52: Q24. In recent weeks, how often have you experienced the following during school? [Q24.2. Someone deliberately left you out of things.]
column53: Q24. In recent weeks, how often have you experienced the following during school? [Q24.3. Someone threatened you.]
column54: Q24. In recent weeks, how often have you experienced the following during school? [Q24.4. Someone physically hurt you.]

column61: Q31. With which racial/ethnic groups do you identify? You can select more than one.
column62: RQ1. Overall, how would you say your school’s phone policy has changed your school?
